skillTree.localised_description: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Those strong enough to tame the powerful, unruly Razorgors can harness them to chariots.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.
"The blood is the prize. The blood is the prize! THE BLOOD IS THE PRIZE!"
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice – a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.
Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The world of man will fall at the Beastlord's hand, with every glittering city reduced to rubble and despair.
Lordship to the mighty! Power to the strong! Obedience is earned through bloody victory!
Carved into this battered and dishevelled stone is the mark of violent rage and sanguine desire.
The Ruinous Powers grant many gifts to their obedient servants; mutant disfigurements of flesh and might.
Granted to those Champions of Chaos who have sworn their loyalty to Khorne, the Blood God.

effects.description:
Spell resistance: 10% for Chosen Khorngors units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Granted to those Champions of Chaos who have sworn their loyalty to the Chaos God Slaanesh, the Lord of Pleasure.

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Speed: +20% for Chosen Slaangors units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Given to the most devoted followers of Tzeentch, the Changer of Ways, bestowing them with potent psychic powers.

effects.description:
Ward save: 5% for Chosen Tzaangors units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Given to Nurgle's greatest followers causing them to become a living host to the powers of death, disease and decay.

effects.description:
Fire resistance: 10% for Chosen Pestigors units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: With a base howl, the beast radiates strength and power, a warning to his enemies that death is coming.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
The desire to wreak havoc is innate, brought about not by choice but by sheer force of being.
The Beastman's fury stretches back before most can remember - they pursue their hatred with single-minded zeal.
The stench of raw, rotten meat causes others to balk, but the warherd revels in the flesh and brawn.
A snorting, hulking mass of blood-matted, mud-encrusted, sanguine-soaked fur - the Beastman is a terror to all.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He who locks horns with this master of the warherd does so at his own peril.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

skillTree.localised_description: At the head of the warherd, he whips his followers into a frothing furore, then unleashes them upon the enemy.

skillTree.localised_description: No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.

skillTree.localised_description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

skillTree.localised_description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."
The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

Spell resistance: 15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.
The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.
For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.
Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: A pungent mix of fell unguents ensures the unholy vitality of one’s minions.

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.
Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: More than mere bloodlust, this one is filled with the primal, Ruinous rage of the Lord of Battle.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one has something of the compost heap about them…
The Dark Tongue is an apt medium through which to torment, mock and enrage the foe.
Sometimes, letting so much blood that the soil itself is stained just isn't enough. And it will never be.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Minotaur units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Blessed by the Dark Gods to never feel pain.
His scent is strong even amongst the herd.
Ungors obey!

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

Melee and missile weapon damage: +10% for Ungor units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Herds crumble but he stands.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Wild as a warhound, he never sleeps.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always watching and stalking his pray!
